accused.name: Hillevix Magister
accused.origin: La Voeniville, prévôté de la Chaulse et terre de Gorze

confession.seduction_date: 7 or 8 years before arrest, around time Spaniards came, perhaps a year after taking of St Dizier
confession.seduction_context: In garden while dissatisfied with quarrel situation; man in black offered vengeance against enemies if she would do as he wished
powder_types: 7 or 8 horns of powder in different colours
sabbat_activities: beating water with stick to make hail and snow at stream (unsuccessful attempt)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Wife threw accusation in accused's face when accused came to make healing soup

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 16 or 17 years earlier

harms_alleged.target: wife of le Grand Martin Jacques
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 16 or 17 years earlier, buried together with husband
after Easter in current year (1584)
after Easter in current year (1584)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Debt repayment of 7 gros when taille was due; complained taille was too high

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 16-17 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Attack by Alizon femme Didier Maurize who called accused witch and pulled out her hair; also report of water beating incident

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 18 months earlier, after taking wine and quichette at her house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Wanted to lease sheep from her brother Jean Cuguin but he leased them to Pierron Marchal instead
testimony.threat_quote: told Pierron he would make no profit

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after lease, 20 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Could not agree on price for eggs
testimony.threat_quote: told his wife she would repent

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after, 2-3 years earlier
soon after, 2-3 years earlier
soon after, 2-3 years earlier
soon after, 2-3 years earlier

witnesses.name: Didier Jacques
witnesses.occupation: Mre echevin en la justice de Vilcey

testimony.quarrel_subject: Argument over quality of money she gave him for wine

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after argument over money

witnesses.name: Colas Collin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: business partner dispute with her brother

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute with her brother Jean Cuguin over jointly leased tilery

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: over following year after ending partnership, 2 years earlier
over following year after ending partnership, 2 years earlier
over following year after ending partnership, 2 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Debt dispute over 16 francs, 4 journals of wheat given as surety

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 years earlier, after taking wine and quichette, great illness in stomach and whole body

testimony.quarrel_subject: Owed her husband money; she swore they owed 7 francs more than was the case

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: died on sixth day after consulting la Queprotte
after threats

testimony.quarrel_subject: She was angry when he leased sheep from her brother Jean; also sick child when neighbors
testimony.threat_quote: said neither he nor the sheep would make profit

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 27 or 28 years earlier when they lived next to her
within the year, 27-28 years earlier
immediately after consulting woman at Corny about evil neighbors
2 weeks after birth attended by accused

harms_alleged.target: first child of Mengeot Grassoye's wife

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: suffered for 6 months before cure

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over payment of remainder for house he had sold her; took her to court
testimony.threat_quote: During case he told her he would rather lose his best horse than renounce what was due, and she said he might well lose two

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: in next few months, 16-18 years earlier
in next few months, 16-18 years earlier
in next few months, 16-18 years earlier

harms_alleged.target: 6-month-old child found out of cot by door

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: No reproaches to witnesses, denied charges except agreed she had been called witch

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: Agreed she was reputed witch, visited sick, made soups, but said all done by devotion and charity

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks for further interrogations and confrontations; if she continues to deny may be given question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture threat; confessed to seduction by devil, receiving powders, harming people and animals

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: Revoked confession saying made in fear; was tortured and renewed confessions; added sexual relations with devil and water beating for hail

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: PG de Lorraine (Maimbourg) asks for further interrogation on details then death

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves in general but says final sentence must await results of interrogation

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: Renewed confession; said seduction around time Spaniards came; confessed everything to curé of Vilcey

timeline.subject: Hillevix Magister
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

notable_quotes.speaker: Wife of Didier Mairase
notable_quotes.french: sorciere jenosse ne me veulx tu poinct reguerir fault il par ton gré je m'en aille mourrir
notable_quotes.english: witch, do you not want to heal me, must I die by your will
notable_quotes.context: Wife threw this in accused's face when Hillevix came to make healing soup

notable_quotes.speaker: Hillevix Magister
notable_quotes.french: maulvaise garce tu as mal faict
notable_quotes.english: bad woman you have done wrong

notable_quotes.speaker: Cuguin Magister (husband)
notable_quotes.context: Seeing soldiers from Viller, thought they were from prévôté coming to arrest them

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierrot le Mareschal
notable_quotes.french: Jenosse sorciere regarde voila de ton ouvraige
notable_quotes.english: witch, look here is your work
notable_quotes.context: Confronting her while carrying skin of dead sheep

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier Jacques
notable_quotes.french: D'aultre mal n'a poinct veu en elle synon peu de bien
notable_quotes.english: Have seen no other harm in her except little good

notable_quotes.speaker: Hillevix Magister
notable_quotes.french: n'a pas esté par mauvaise intention ains par devotion et charité
notable_quotes.english: was not by bad intention but by devotion and charity
notable_quotes.context: Defense during interrogation about visiting sick and making soups

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierresson Destain
notable_quotes.context: Strange sounds made by accused lying under chimney in kitchen, white and frightened

relationships.evidence_text: his father, Yzabel veuve Colas le Bourlier
his daughter Cathin (now married at Thiaucourt)
When they lived next to her some 27 or 28 years earlier

economic_context.details: Multiple debt disputes: Gigons Jacques owed 7 gros; Laurent Pacquin disputed amount owed (claimed 7 francs more than actual); Colas le Bourlier owed 16 francs with 4 journals of wheat as surety; Bastien Grassoye dispute over house sale payment. Wine selling business caused quarrel with Mengeot Grassoye's wife. Taille (tax) payment mentioned as pressure point.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Could not eat soup made by accused, it dribbled out of mouth, died with wife and buried together

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of le Grand Martin Jacques
harms_catalog.harm_description: Died with husband and buried together
Ill in bed for several days after haymaking and taking wine and quichette at her house; later healed by accused

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She wanted the sheep but her brother leased them to Pierron
Could not agree on price for eggs; told wife she would repent
Could not agree on price for eggs
Argument over quality of money she gave for wine
Dispute with her brother Jean Cuguin over jointly leased tilery
Dispute with her brother over tilery

harms_catalog.harm_description: Bad leg, great illness in stomach and whole body, in bed for 3 days in great distress after taking wine and quichette; later healed by accused
Died on sixth day; la Queprotte diagnosed 'mal donné' from a woman, loppin above heart
So ill that wife told Hillevix she was dying; recovered in half hour after Hillevix visited

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She was angry when he leased sheep from her brother; said neither he nor sheep would profit

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: immediately after consulting woman at Corny about evil neighbors

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died 2 weeks after birth attended by Hillevix

harms_catalog.victim_name: first child of Mengeot Grassoye's wife

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness suffered for 6 months; cured when ate joutte with meat given by accused

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over house sale payment; he said would rather lose best horse than renounce debt, she said he might well lose two
harms_catalog.method_alleged: marchal could do nothing for them

harms_catalog.harm_description: Found out of cot and by the door during night
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: during period of misfortunes, 16-18 years earlier

material_culture.context: Made by accused to heal sick people
Sold by accused and husband; consumed before illness
Jacquemin Tout Bon tried to sell to accused but could not agree on price
Given by accused to Mariotte Collin, which cured her illness
Given as surety for debt of 16 francs

material_culture.object: 7 or 8 horns of powder in different colours
material_culture.context: Given by devil Mre Martin for maleficia
Given by devil along with powder
Used by accused to cure people
Used to beat water to make hail and snow; also Colas le Bourlier used stick due to bad leg
Borrowed by accused from Mariotte Collin for grain
Bastien Grassoye tried to kill accused with sword
Pierrot le Mareschal carried skin of dead sheep back to village

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused
Where accused was arrested and taken; where witch was executed; where Capitaine was based

spatial_references.place_name: La Voeniville in prévôté de la Chaulse et terre de Gorze
spatial_references.context: Birthplace of accused; lived there 4 years after marriage

spatial_references.place_name: La Va Nalbe, ban de Chenimont
spatial_references.context: Where la Queprotte lived, who divined illnesses
Where Cathin (daughter of Pierrot le Mareschal) was married
Residence of witness Thiery fils Claudin Thiery
Residence of Colin Fillette dit Rengier
Where woman lived who told Pierrot le Mareschal he had evil neighbors
Where soldiers came from that husband thought were from prévôté
Where accused beat water to make hail and snow; where accused put powder to kill horses
Where man in black (devil) first approached accused
Target for hail that accused tried to make
Referenced for timing of seduction (year after taking of St Dizier)
Monastery where curé of Vilcey was a monk
Where curé of Vilcey later served

historical_context.military_details: Spaniards mentioned (timing of seduction); soldiers from Viller whom husband thought were from prévôté; Capitaine of Preny mentioned; reference to 'taking of St Dizier'
weather_events: hail and snow that accused tried to make by beating water

officials_named.name: curé of Vilcey, monk of St Marie, subsequently curé at Ley

prior_legal_disputes.description: Bastien Grassoye took accused to court over payment of remainder for house he had sold her

legal_context.redress_outcome: Multiple witnesses testified they called her witch publicly without her seeking reparation

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Initially approved use of question extraordinaire if she continued to deny (1 June 1584); later approved death sentence in general pending final interrogation (15 June 1584); final approval of death sentence (18 June 1584)

hearsay_chains.content: Her daughter-in-law Babon claimed to have found her beating water
Claimed she caused death of his wife's first child
They suspected her over death of a child

hearsay_chains.source: la Queprotte at La Va Nalbe
hearsay_chains.content: Diagnosed mother-in-law's illness as 'mal donné' from a woman

emotional_state_notes: No reproaches to witnesses during confrontation
Claimed all actions were 'par devotion et charité' (by devotion and charity)
Revoked confession saying it was made in fear of torture
Confessed everything to curé of Vilcey
Strange incident lying under chimney saying 'quac, quac, quac', white and frightened

third_parties.name: le Grand Martin Jacques
third_parties.context: Became ill 16-17 years earlier, suspected her, sent for her to heal him with soup; could not eat it and died with wife

third_parties.name: wife of le Grand Martin Jacques
third_parties.context: Died with husband and buried together in 'une fosse'

third_parties.name: Alizon femme Didier Maurize
third_parties.context: Called accused witch and pulled out some of her hair in attack; accused said she was in such a state she did not know what she was doing

third_parties.name: Babon (daughter-in-law of Jean Grassoye)
third_parties.context: Claimed to have found accused beating water; said Hillevix was a witch and she would have her burned

third_parties.name: Pierron Marchal
third_parties.context: She wanted the sheep but her brother Jean leased them to Pierron; she threatened him; sheep died; he called her witch several times

third_parties.name: Jean Cuguin
third_parties.context: Leased sheep to Pierron; in partnership dispute with Colas Collin over tilery

third_parties.name: Mengeot Grassoye
third_parties.context: Worked land in association; wife caused quarrel by dissuading wine customers

third_parties.name: wife of Mengeot Grassoye
third_parties.context: Dissuaded wine customers saying they would be given 'boucots' to eat which would make them ill

third_parties.name: Colas Collin
third_parties.context: Advised witnesses in Colas Bourlier's illness

third_parties.name: curé of Vilcey
third_parties.context: Monk of St Marie, subsequently curé at Ley; accused confessed everything to him, after which devil did not appear to her

third_parties.name: la Queprotte at La Va Nalbe, ban de Chenimont
third_parties.context: Had custom of divining illnesses; diagnosed Laurent Pacquin's mother-in-law with 'mal donné' from a woman

third_parties.name: woman at Corny
third_parties.context: Told Pierrot le Mareschal he had evil neighbors

third_parties.name: Cathin (daughter of Pierrot le Mareschal)
third_parties.context: So ill wife said she was dying; recovered in half hour after Hillevix visited; now married at Thiaucourt

third_parties.name: marchal (farrier)
third_parties.context: Could do nothing for Bastien Grassoye's dying horses

third_parties.name: Mre Martin (devil)
third_parties.context: Man in black who seduced accused in garden, gave her powder and herbs, had intercourse with her twice, beat her

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial with 19 witnesses providing extensive testimony. Clear pattern of quarrel-threat-harm sequence. Accused had dual role as both healer and suspected witch. Multiple successful healings mentioned alongside accusations of harm. Confession obtained under torture and retracted, then renewed. Economic disputes (debts, property, business competition) feature prominently. Reputation spans up to 30 years. No accomplices named. Notable that accused confessed to curé before final interrogations.
